SEARCH
Package com.greenloop.event_service.controllers

Class EventController

java.lang.Object
com.greenloop.event_service.controllers.EventController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api/events") public class EventController extends Object
REST controller for event management and querying.

Handles both CRUD operations (admin-only) and query operations (public/user). Merges command and query responsibilities for a simpler, unified API.

Base Path: /api/events

See Also:

    • createEvent

      @PostMapping @ResponseStatus(CREATED) public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ApiResponse<EventResponse>> createEvent(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid CreateEventRequest request, @RequestHeader("X-User-Role") String userRole)
      Creates a new event (admin-only).
      Parameters:
      request - event details
      userRole - authenticated user role from gateway (X-User-Role header)
      Returns:
      newly created event wrapped in ApiResponse
      Throws:
      RoleNotAllowedException - if user is not an admin

    • updateEvent

      @PutMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ApiResponse<EventResponse>> updateEvent(@PathVariable UUID id, @Valid @RequestBody @Valid UpdateEventRequest request, @RequestHeader("X-User-Role") String userRole)
      Updates an existing event (admin-only).
      Parameters:
      id - event UUID
      request - updated event details
      userRole - authenticated user role from gateway (X-User-Role header)
      Returns:
      updated event wrapped in ApiResponse
      Throws:
      RoleNotAllowedException - if user is not an admin

    • deleteEvent

      @DeleteMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Void> deleteEvent(@PathVariable UUID id, @RequestHeader("X-User-Role") String userRole)
      Deletes an event permanently (admin-only).
      Parameters:
      id - event UUID
      userRole - authenticated user role from gateway (X-User-Role header)
      Returns:
      204 No Content on successful deletion
      Throws:
      RoleNotAllowedException - if user is not an admin

    • scanAndMarkAttendance

      @PostMapping("/scan") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ApiResponse<EventAttendeeResponse>> scanAndMarkAttendance(@RequestBody ScanRequest req, @RequestHeader("X-User-ID") String userId, @RequestHeader("X-User-Email") String userEmail)
      Marks attendance for the authenticated user by scanning a QR token.

      The QR token uniquely identifies the event; therefore, no eventId is required in the path.

      Parameters:
      req - the scan request containing the QR token
      userId - authenticated user ID from gateway (X-User-ID header)
      userEmail - authenticated user email from gateway (X-User-Email header)
      Returns:
      attendance status wrapped in ApiResponse
